result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel A Horton Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and victim witness surcharges. To be paid by 5/22/2017.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  STAYED to 5/29/15 by noon.
Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work, AODA treatment and childcare.

Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use  or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel A Horton Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel A Horton in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 15 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work, AODA treatment and child care. STAYED to 5/29/2015 by noon.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 5/22/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 5/22/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
sentencing letter received and filed. sab

Defendant Joel A Horton in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Attorney Behm on behalf of Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
BRANCH 17 FOR BRANCH 15. 
 AS TO COUNT 1  - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joel A Horton in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 4/21/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Joel A Horton in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Paul Hauer for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joel A Horton in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Joel A Horton in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
